tags.string: {array} Required scopes for the Search API.
tags.html: {array} Required scopes for the Search API.

tags.string: {string} Base URL for the Search API.
tags.html: {string} Base URL for the Search API.

var gcloud = require('gcloud')({
keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json',
projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123'
});

var search = gcloud.search();

description.full:
Create a Search object to Interact with the Cloud Search API. Using this
object, you can access your indexes with {module:search/index} and documents
with {module:search/document}.

Follow along with the examples to see how to do everything from creating
documents to searching indexes.
description.summary:
Create a Search object to Interact with the Cloud Search API. Using this
object, you can access your indexes with {module:search/index} and documents
with {module:search/document}.
description.body:
Follow along with the examples to see how to do everything from creating
documents to searching indexes.

tags.string:
{string} query.pageSize - The maximum number of indexes to return per
    page. If not specified, 100 indexes are returned per page.
tags.name: query.pageSize
tags.description: • The maximum number of indexes to return per page. If not specified, 100 indexes are returned per page.

tags.string:
{string} query.pageToken - A previously-returned page token
    representing part of the larger set of results to view.
tags.name: query.pageToken
tags.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

tags.string:
{string} query.prefix - The prefix of the index name. It is used to
    list all indexes with names that have this prefix.
tags.name: query.prefix
tags.description: • The prefix of the index name. It is used to list all indexes with names that have this prefix.

tags.string:
{string} query.view - See [this table](https://goo.gl/sY6Lpt) for a
    list of accepted values and what each will do.
tags.name: query.view
tags.description: • See this table for a list of accepted values and what each will do.

tags.html:
function onApiResponse(err, indexes, nextQuery, apiResponse) {
if (err) {
console.error(err);
return;
}

if (nextQuery) {
search.getIndexes(nextQuery, onApiResponse);
}
}

search.getIndexes(onApiResponse);

//-
// Customize the request using a query object.
//-
search.getIndexes({
pageSize: 10
}, onApiResponse);

//-
// Get the indexes as a readable object stream.
//-
search.getIndexes()
.on('error', console.error)
.on('data', function(index) {
// index is an Index object.
})
.on('end', function() {
// All indexes retrieved.
});

description.full: Get {module:search/index} objects for all of the indexes in your project.
description.summary: Get {module:search/index} objects for all of the indexes in your project.

description.full: Get a reference to a Google Cloud Search index.
description.summary: Get a reference to a Google Cloud Search index.

description.full:
Make a new request object from the provided arguments and wrap the callback
to intercept non-successful responses.
description.summary:
Make a new request object from the provided arguments and wrap the callback
to intercept non-successful responses.

description.full:
Developer Documentation

{module:search#getIndexes} can be used with either a callback or as a
readable object stream. streamRouter is used to add this dual behavior.
description.body:
{module:search#getIndexes} can be used with either a callback or as a
readable object stream. streamRouter is used to add this dual behavior.
